summary: This is an email exchange between a Senior Forensic Examiner (NY CART Coordinator) and an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York. The examiner provides an update on the forensic imaging of devices seized from Jeffrey Epstein's properties in New York and the Virgin Islands, indicating most are complete and delivery is imminent.

persons.name: M, (USANYS)
persons.context: The email sender from the Southern District of New York inquiring about the status of forensic images from Epstein devices seized in New York and the Virgin Islands.

persons.name: Fiume
persons.role: Senior Forensic Examiner, NY CART Coordinator
persons.context: The email recipient and responder who worked over the weekend to image devices from Epstein properties and provides a delivery timeline.

connections.description: Prosecutor and forensic examiner communicating about evidence processing in the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Forensic Imaging Update
events.description: Senior Forensic Examiner Fiume provides an update that imaging of devices from Epstein's New York and Virgin Islands properties is nearly complete, with delivery expected soon.

keyFacts: Forensic imaging was being conducted on electronic devices seized from Jeffrey Epstein's properties in New York and the Virgin Islands.
The imaging process was nearly complete as of October 13, 2020, with only 5-6 machines remaining.
The correspondence indicates active post-arrest investigation into evidence from Epstein's properties.
The document is subject to a protective order restricting certain paragraphs.
